TEXT: The applicants , GPE . PERSON and PERSON , are NORP nationals who were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE . They were represented before the ORG by GPE . PERSON and PERSON Derin , lawyers practising in GPE .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the first applicant was taken into police custody on suspicion of aiding and abetting an illegal organisation , namely ORG ( “ the NORP ” ) and was subsequently placed in detention on remand .
ORG at ORG initiated criminal proceedings against him and CARDINAL others . He requested that the applicant be convicted and sentenced under LAW of LAW and LAW no . ORG .
On DATE the trial commenced before ORG against CARDINAL persons , including the first applicant .
On DATE police officers from ORG apprehended the second applicant . On DATE ORG at ORG filed an indictment charging him with membership of an illegal organisation .
On DATE the proceedings against the second applicant , together with CARDINAL others , commenced before ORG .
On DATE the court joined the second applicant ’s case to the first applicant ’s case pending before a different chamber of the court .
On DATE CARDINAL other cases were joined to the applicants’ proceedings .
On DATE the court acquitted the first applicant on account of lack of evidence . Moreover , it convicted the second applicant and sentenced him to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment .
While the case was pending at the appeal stage , on DATE , after the promulgation of PERSON no . CARDINAL , which abolished ORG , the case - file was transferred to ORG .
On DATE ORG quashed the decision of ORG for procedural reasons .
The first hearing before ORG took place on DATE . The court took the statements of some of the accused concerning ORG decision to quash the judgment of DATE .

At the hearing of DATE and during the following QUANTITY hearings the other accused submitted their comments on the decision of ORG . According to the minutes , when some of the accused wanted to read out loud their written defence statements the court informed them that the examination of the merits would be carried out once the procedural stage was completed .
On DATE the LAW was amended and the military judges sitting on the bench of ORG were replaced by civilian judges .

At the hearing of DATE the civilian judge who had been appointed to replace the military judge sat as a member of the trial court for the first time . DATE and DATE the ORG , which was composed of CARDINAL civilian judges , held QUANTITY hearings .
On DATE CARDINAL other cases were joined to the applicants’ proceedings .

At the sixteenth hearing held on DATE , the number of accused before the court was DATE . The court , composed of CARDINAL civilian judges , found the applicants guilty as charged . It sentenced the first applicant to DATE and QUANTITY months’ imprisonment and the second applicant to DATE and QUANTITY months’ imprisonment . The applicants appealed .

On DATE the court gave an additional decision in which it suspended the proceedings in respect of the first applicant and CARDINAL others , in accordance with PERSON no . DATE on conditional release , the suspension of proceedings or the execution of sentences in respect of crimes committed before DATE .

On DATE ORG decided that the criminal proceedings against the first applicant be terminated on the ground that the statutory time - limit under LAW of LAW had expired . It further decided to uphold the decision of ORG in respect of the second applicant , endorsing the first instance court ’s assessment of the evidence and its reasons for rejecting his defence .

The relevant domestic law and practice in force at the material time are outlined in the following judgments : PERSON v. GPE ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE , DATE ) and PERSON v. GPE ( [ ORG ] , no . MONEY , § DATE ... ) .
